required_outline.I. Executive Summary: One- to three-page description of the business model
required_outline.II. Analysis of the International Busine: Economic, political and legal analysis; trade area and cultural analysis
required_outline.III. Problem: Description of the problems the product/service is addressing
required_outline.V. Unique Value Proposition: Single, clear, compelling message that states the unique value proposition
required_outline.VI. Solution: Description of the top features of the product/service that solve the problem
required_outline.VII. Channels: Descriptions of the pathways to customers
required_outline.VIII. Revenue Stream: Description of the revenue model and lifetime values
required_outline.IX. Cost Structure: Explanation of customer acquisition costs, distribution costs, human resources costs and additional costs
required_outline.X. Detailed Financials: Projected income and expenses and proposed plan to meet capital needs
required_outline.XI. Key Metrics: Explanation of the key activities that must be measured
required_outline.XII. Competitive Advantage: Explanation of why the product/service cannot be easily copied or bought
required_outline.XIII. Conclusion: Specific request for financing, summary of key points supporting the financial request
